column2: I'd recommend you steer clear of the side dishes and appetizers if you are dining on any sort of budget. Some are worth the splurge on a special occasion
column3: but the dishes that people rave about in some of the reviews are really nothing much. The pork bun is not bad
column5: there are cheaper pork buns out there that taste better
column6: and the size is just measly for the price you pay. Karaage is just Karaage
column7: and you can definitely expect to pay extra for your fried chicken at a trendy ramen spot. The rice bowls aren't bad
column8: but if you wanted to eat rice why not just pick up some fried rice from a solid spot in Chinatown?
